etymology.description: 木(木) (mù, "tree/wood") + 各(各) (gè, "each") = structure, as in parts of a tree -> form, pattern -> grammatical unit
etymology.interpretation: The character 格(格) (gé) combines 木(木) (mù, "tree/wood"), suggesting structure or framework, with 各(各) (gè, "each"), which provides the phonetic component. This combination implies a structured pattern, much like grammatical rules.

examples.chinese: 这个句子中的每个词格都有特定的意义(這個句子中的每個詞格都有特定的意義)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège jùzi zhōng de měi gè cígé dōu yǒu tèdìng de yìyì.
examples.english: Each grammatical unit in this sentence carries its specific meaning.

examples.chinese: 语法中不同的格负责表达不同的语义(語法中不同的格負責表達不同的語義)。
examples.pinyin: Yǔfǎ zhōng bùtóng de gé fùzé biǎodá bùtóng de yǔyì.
examples.english: Different grammatical units in grammar express different semantics.
